properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions will continue in Kugluktuk this morning with strong northwest winds gusting up to 70 km/h. Conditions are expected to improve in the next few hours as the wind weakens. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T14:29:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T08:19:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0530257476.2020
Area: Kugluktuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are occurring. Blizzard conditions will continue in Gjoa Haven and Taloyoak this morning as northeast winds gust up to 80 km/h. Conditions will improve later Monday morning when the winds weaken. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T17:59:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T08:21:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1546010945.2020
Area: Taloyoak, Gjoa Haven
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The passage of a cold front brought strong northwest winds and near blizzard conditions to Baker Lake. Blizzard or near blizzard conditions will continue at Baker Lake today and through most of Monday night. Some blowing snow will persist through the day on Tuesday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-17T00:25:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T08:26:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2518153617.2020
Area: Baker Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds gusting upwards of 100 kilometres per hour are affecting this region. They will gradually diminish throughout the day. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T15:59:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T08:15:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4269557675.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, at times heavy near Lake Superior on Monday. Snow will begin early Monday morning with snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm possible by Monday evening from Pic River to Wawa. From Wawa to Montreal River, similar snowfall amounts are possible by early Tuesday morning. The highest amounts are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline. Be prepared to adjust your driving with quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-16T18:07:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T02:08:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2633069757.2020
Area: White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today into tonight. Snow, at times heavy is expected near Lake Superior. Snow will continue today with snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm possible by this evening from Terrace Bay to Wawa. From Wawa to Montreal River, similar snowfall amounts are possible by early Tuesday morning. The highest amounts are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline. Be prepared to adjust your driving with quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-17T02:12:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-16T10:13:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3812899390.2020
Area: Marathon - Schreiber, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada
